(2011) | Misc = }} "'''Welcome to the Family'''" is a [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] song by the [[United States|American]] [[heavy metal music|metal]] band [[Avenged Sevenfold]], released as the second [[Single (music)|single]] for their fifth studio album, ''[[Nightmare (Avenged Sevenfold album)|Nightmare]]''.{{cite web| url= http://www.theprp.com/2010/10/06/news/avenged-sevenfold-select-next-single-from-nightmare/| title= Avenged Sevenfold Select Next Single From "Nightmare"| work= [[Blabbermouth.net]]| publisher= [[Roadrunner Records|Roadrunner]]| date= May 14, 2010| accessdate= May 14, 2010}} It is the band's second single released without former [[Drum kit|drummer]] "[[The Rev]]", who died on December 28, 2009.{{cite web| url= http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=140059| title= Late AVENGED SEVENFOLD Drummer 'Appears' On Band's New Album| work= [[Blabbermouth.net]]| publisher= [[Roadrunner Records|Roadrunner]]| date= May 14, 2010| accessdate= May 14, 2010}} In the news [http://www.theprp.com/ Theprp.com] mention the second single from the album Nightmare is "Welcome to the Family", scheduled to be played on the radio starting on October 19, 2010.{{cite web| url= http://www.theprp.com/2010/10/06/news/avenged-sevenfold-select-next-single-from-nightmare| title= The second single from albums Nightmare is Welcome to the Family, will play at October 19, 2010 on radio}} In Avenged Sevenfold's "making of" series on [[YouTube]], ''In the Studio'', singer [[M. Shadows]] and bassist [[Johnny Christ]] say that the song was inspired by [[The Rev]]. No plans for a music video have been made so far. The song is playable as DLC in the video game [[Rock Band 3]].[http://www.rockband.com/blog/a7x-live-chumbawamba-aha-dlc] ==Reception== On [[Active Rock|''Active Rock'' radio]] Charts, they are now #1 and #15 on [[Alternative Songs]] charts, #2 on [[U.S.]] ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Mainstream Rock Tracks]] charts.
